comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@Alex-302 Yes, you do have to finish a race before going to the home page. It takes minimal time to finish it and after you're done you can just input a random username and password to get to the page shown in the screenshots

Attached is a picture of the page zoomed out with the missing part circled in red:
![Screenshot 2024-01-04 183942](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/84996635/e2011a28-48bb-4f8d-add0-9acc61db5787)


Through some testing it seems that the annoyance filter is causing an issue. The bigger problem here is that I do not have the annoyance filters activated. What I discovered is that when I turn on the annoyance filter (the overall toggle), it breaks the website in question. But, when I turn off and on all of the filters (not including the annoyance filter), it fixes the issue on the website. This seems to be an overall adguard issue because it seems that when the annoyance filters are toggled off, they aren't actually off until you turn off the rest of the adguard toggles. Another solution could be just fixing the error in one of the annoyance filters.

Then compare two dumps at this address; > https://www.dobreprogramy.pl/oszusci-coraz-bardziej-podstepni-bank-pekao-apeluje,6980372705446400a > > > - the first dump is the list Language-specific ON and the second is OFF > > Selected for you - these are unnecessary elements that clutter up the website and, as you can see, such rules are in one of the special lists from the Language-specific set > Almost every domain in the wp.pl group contains uncut this type of garbage, so check the list of domains I recently posted and add some rules, because I will be forced to file a complaint about incompetence and I wouldn't want that. Derick > ### [NSFW] Screenshots

issue.title: youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment > When adguard protection is running in the background, opening YouTube in either firefox, edge or chrome will result in the screen being blocked by the mosaic, but as soon as adguard protection is turned off and refresh the page, the screen will return to normal. (No custom rules added, adguard maintains default settings) I tried uninstalling ublock but no improvement, but when ublock is the only one running it blocks YouTube ads properly. Username: `@tuntematon` ### [NSFW] Screenshots
